mftools.assess package

Submodules

mftools.assess.classify module

mftools.assess.classify.train_rf(xtrain, xtest, ytrain, ytest)[source]

Train random forest on training data, validate on test data and compute accuracy score for the validation.

Parameters

  • xtrain (ndarray) – Array of fingerprints with shape \((n_{\text{train}}, d)\), where \(n_{\text{train}}\) is the number of fingerprints within the training set and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

  • xtest (ndarray) – Array of fingerprints with shape \((n_{\text{test}}, d)\), where \(n_{\text{test}}\) is the number of fingerprints within the test set and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

  • ytrain (ndarray) – List of labels corresponding to xtrain, with shape \((n_{\text{train}}, )\).

  • ytest (ndarray) – List of labels corresponding to xtest, with shape \((n_{\text{test}}, )\).

Returns

accuracy – Accuracy score when validating random forest on test data. Has range [0, 1].

Return type

float

mftools.assess.classify.train_ssl(xtrain, xtest, ytrain, ytest, frac_data)[source]

Propagate labels via semi-supervised learning (SSL) and compute accuracy score.

Parameters

  • xtrain (ndarray) – Array of fingerprints with shape \((n_{\text{train}}, d)\), where \(n_{\text{train}}\) is the number of fingerprints within the training set and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

  • xtest (ndarray) – Array of fingerprints with shape \((n_{\text{test}}, d)\), where \(n_{\text{test}}\) is the number of fingerprints within the test set and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

  • ytrain (ndarray) – List of labels corresponding to xtrain, with shape \((n_{\text{train}}, )\).

  • ytest (ndarray) – List of labels corresponding to xtest, with shape \((n_{\text{test}}, )\).

  • frac_data (float) – Fraction of ytrain used to initialise label propagation. Must have range (0, 1).

Returns

  • acc_laplace (float) – Accuracy score when validating SSL on test data via laplace learning. Has range [0, 1].

  • acc_poisson (float) – Accuracy score when validating SSL on test data via poisson learning. Has range [0, 1].

mftools.assess.classify.train_svm(xtrain, xtest, ytrain, ytest, kernel='linear')[source]

Train support vector machine (SVM) on training data, validate on test data and compute accuracy score for the validation.

Parameters

  • xtrain (ndarray) – Array of fingerprints with shape \((n_{\text{train}}, d)\), where \(n_{\text{train}}\) is the number of fingerprints within the training set and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

  • xtest (ndarray) – Array of fingerprints with shape \((n_{\text{test}}, d)\), where \(n_{\text{test}}\) is the number of fingerprints within the test set and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

  • ytrain (ndarray) – List of labels corresponding to xtrain, with shape \((n_{\text{train}}, )\).

  • ytest (ndarray) – List of labels corresponding to xtest, with shape \((n_{\text{test}}, )\).

Returns

accuracy – Accuracy score when validating SVM on test data. Has range [0, 1].

Return type

float

mftools.assess.classify.train_ul(xtrain, xtest, ytest, nclass, method='kmeans')[source]

Perform unsupervised learning (UL) on training data and compute accuracy score. Supports k-means and spectral clustering via the method parameter.

Parameters

  • xtrain (ndarray) – Array of fingerprints with shape \((n_{\text{train}}, d)\), where \(n_{\text{train}}\) is the number of fingerprints within the training set and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

  • xtest (ndarray) – Array of fingerprints with shape \((n_{\text{test}}, d)\), where \(n_{\text{test}}\) is the number of fingerprints within the test set and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

  • ytest (ndarray) – List of labels corresponding to xtest, with shape \((n_{\text{test}}, )\).

  • nclass (int) – Number of classes to split data into.

  • method (str) –

    ‘kmeans’ (deafult)

    \(k\)-means clustering.

    ’spectral’

    Spectral clustering.

Returns

accuracy – Accuracy score when validating UL on test data. Has range [0, 1].

Return type

float
